title: All primes 4n+1 are the sum of two squares

blocks.name: 2sqlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ 2sq . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wrex(s0, cgz, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2))))
  -| wceq(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(wb(wcel(c0, c1), wrex(s0, cgz, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2)))), diffsc(s0, c1))
  bitri(wcel(c0, c1), wrex(s0, cgz, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, crn(cmpt(s1, cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2)))))
  eleq2i(c0, c1, crn(cmpt(s1, cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2))))
  elrnmpti(s0, c0, cmpt(s1, cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2)), cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2))
  cbvmptv(s1, s0, cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2), co(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2))
  oveq1d(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2, cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  fveq2(cv(s1), cv(s0), cabs)
  ovex(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2)
  diff.cgz.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cabs, cv(s0))
  diff.cabs.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cexp.s(s1)
  diff.nat2.s(s1)
  diff.cgz.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cexp, nat2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cabs, cv(s1))
  diff.cabs.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cexp.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm 2sqlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 ↔ ∃(s0 ∈ Z[i], c0 =((abs ` s0)[^]2)))
  ⊣ c1 = ran((s1 ∈ Z[i]↦((abs ` s1)[^]2)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ∈ c1 ↔ ∃(s0 ∈ Z[i], c0 =((abs ` s0)[^]2))), d(s0, c1))
  bitri(c0 ∈ c1, ∃(s0 ∈ Z[i], c0 =((abs ` s0)[^]2)), c0 ∈ ran((s1 ∈ Z[i]↦((abs ` s1)[^]2))))
  eleq2i(c0, c1, ran((s1 ∈ Z[i]↦((abs ` s1)[^]2))))
  elrnmpti(s0, c0, (s1 ∈ Z[i]↦((abs ` s1)[^]2)), cgz, ((abs ` s0)[^]2))
  cbvmptv(s1, s0, cgz, ((abs ` s1)[^]2), ((abs ` s0)[^]2))
  oveq1d((abs ` s1), cexp, nat2, (abs ` s0), s1 = s0)
  fveq2(s1, s0, cabs)
  ovex((abs ` s0), cexp, nat2)
  diff.cgz.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, (abs ` s0), cexp, nat2)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cabs, s0)
  diff.cabs.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cexp.s(s1)
  diff.nat2.s(s1)
  diff.cgz.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, (abs ` s1), cexp, nat2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cabs, s1)
  diff.cabs.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cexp.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: mul2sq
blocks.content: Fibonacci's identity (actually due to Diophantus). The product of two sums of two squares is also a sum of two squares. We can take advantage of Gaussian integers here to trivialize the proof. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mul2sq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), c1))
  -| wceq(c1, crn(cmpt(s0, cgz, co(cfv(cabs, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2))))
} = {
  syl2anb(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), c1), wrex(hs0, cgz, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2))), wrex(hs1, cgz, wceq(c2, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2))))
  2sqlem1(hs0, s0, c0, c1)
  2sqlem1(hs1, s0, c2, c1)
  sylbir(wa(wrex(hs0, cgz, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2))), wrex(hs1, cgz, wceq(c2, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)))), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), c1), wrex(hs0, cgz, wrex(hs1, cgz, wa(wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2)), wceq(c2, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2))))))
  reeanv(hs0, hs1, cgz, cgz, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2)), wceq(c2, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)))
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, cgz, cgz, wa(wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2)), wceq(c2, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2))), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), c1))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cgz), wcel(cv(hs1), cgz)), wa(wceq(c0, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2)), wceq(c2, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2))), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), c1), wcel(co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)), c1))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cgz), wcel(cv(hs1), cgz)), wcel(co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)), c1), wrex(hs2, cgz, wceq(co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs2)), cexp, nat2))))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cgz), wcel(cv(hs1), cgz)), wrex(hs2, cgz, wceq(co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs2)), cexp, nat2))), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cmul, cv(hs1)), cgz), wceq(co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmul, cv(hs1))), cexp, nat2)))
  gzmulcl(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  eqtr2d(co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cexp, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs1)), cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmul, cv(hs1))), cexp, nat2), co(co(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cmul, cfv(cabs, cv(hs1))), cexp, nat2), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cgz), wcel(cv(hs1), cgz)))

blocks.name: 2sqlem5
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ 2sq . If a number that is a sum of two squares is divisible by a prime that is a sum of two squares, then the quotient is a sum of two squares. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: 2sqlem6
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ 2sq . If a number that is a sum of two squares is divisible by a number whose prime divisors are all sums of two squares, then the quotient is a sum of two squares. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: 2sqlem10
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ 2sq . Every factor of a "proper" sum of two squares (where the summands are coprime) is a sum of two squares. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: 2sq
blocks.content: All primes of the form ` 4 k + 1 ` are sums of two squares. This is Metamath 100 proof #20. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  2sqlem2(s0, s1, hs0, c0, ran((hs0 ∈ Z[i]↦((abs ` hs0)[^]2))))

  oveq1d(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c2, cexp, nat2), nat0, wceq(c0, nat0))

  addid2d(co(c2, cexp, nat2), w0)
  sqcld(c2, w0)

}

blocks.name: 2sqcoprm
blocks.content: If the sum of two squares is prime, the two original numbers are coprime. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqcoprm(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))

  syl21anc(wa(w0, wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cn), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wn(wa(wceq(c0, nat0), wceq(c1, nat0))))
  adantr(w0, wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c0, cz))
  adantr(w0, wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, cz))

  mtand(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cprime))
  syl(w0, wn(wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cprime)), wcel(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cz))
  sqnprm(co(c0, cgcd, c1))
  eqeltrd(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cprime, c2, wa(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2))))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2))), wceq(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), c2), wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c2))
  adantr(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c2))
  breqtrd(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c2, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), w0)

  syl(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cz), wcel(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cz))
  zsqcl(co(c0, cgcd, c1))

  imp(wa(wcel(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c0), wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))
  dvdssqim(co(c0, cgcd, c1), c0)
  syl21anc(w0, wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cz), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c1))
  nn0zd(co(c0, cgcd, c1), w0)
  gcdcld(c0, c1, w0)
  simprd(w0, wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c1), wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c0))
  syl2anc(w0, wa(wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c0), wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c1)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  gcddvds(c0, c1)
  imp(wa(wcel(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cdvds, c1), wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, co(c1, cexp, nat2)))
  dvdssqim(co(c0, cgcd, c1), c1)
  imp(w3a(wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cz), wcel(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cz)), wa(wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, co(c1, cexp, nat2))), wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2))))
  dvds2add(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cexp, nat2), co(c1, cexp, nat2))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2))), wb(wbr(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c2), wceq(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), c2)), wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c2, cprime))
  simpr(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  dvdsprm(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), c2)
  adantr(w0, wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c2, cprime))
  eluz2b3(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2))
  imnan(wcel(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), cn), wne(co(co(c0, cgcd, c1), cexp, nat2), nat1))

blocks.name: 2sqmod
blocks.content: Given two decompositions of a prime as a sum of two squares, show that they are equal. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqmod(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cprime))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cn0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cn0))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cn0))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cle, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cle, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), c4))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c3, cexp, nat2)), c4))

  jca(w0, wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3))

  adantr(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(c2, cr))

  adantr(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wbr(nat0, cle, c2))
  subeq0d(co(c1, cexp, nat2), co(c2, cexp, nat2), wa(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2)))))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cc))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(co(c2, cexp, nat2), cc))
  mpbir2and(wa(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2)))), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), nat0), wbr(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), cle, nat0), wbr(nat0, cle, co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2))))
  eqbrtrrd(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), cle, nat0, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c3, cexp, nat2)), wa(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2)))))

  adantr(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c4, cdvds, co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(co(c3, cexp, nat2), cc))

blocks.name: 2sqmo
blocks.content: There exists at most one decomposition of a prime as a sum of two squares. See ~ 2sqb for the existence of such a decomposition. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cprime), wrmo(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: 2sqnn0
blocks.content: All primes of the form ` 4 k + 1 ` are sums of squares of two nonnegative integers. (Contributed by AV, 3-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqnn0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wrex(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(c0, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wrex(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(c0, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))))), wrex(hs0, cz, wrex(hs1, cz, wceq(c0, co(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(hs1), cexp, nat2))))))
  2sq(hs0, hs1, c0)
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, cz, cz, wceq(c0, co(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(hs1), cexp, nat2))), wrex(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(c0, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))))))
  ex(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wcel(cv(hs1), cz)), wceq(c0, co(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(hs1), cexp, nat2))), wrex(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(c0, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))))))

blocks.name: 2sqnn
blocks.content: All primes of the form ` 4 k + 1 ` are sums of squares of two positive integers. (Contributed by AV, 11-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: addsq2reu
blocks.content: For each complex number ` C ` , there exists a unique complex number ` a ` added to the square of a unique another complex number ` b ` resulting in the given complex number ` C ` . The unique complex number ` a ` is ` C ` , and the unique another complex number ` b ` is ` 0 ` . Remark: This, together with ~ addsqnreup , is an example showing that the pattern ` E! a e. A E! b e. B ph ` does not necessarily mean "There are unique sets ` a ` and ` b ` fulfilling ` ph ` ). See also comments for ~ df-eu and ~ 2eu4 . For more details see comment for ~ addsqnreup . (Contributed by AV, 21-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: addsqn2reu
blocks.content: For each complex number ` C ` , there does not exist a unique complex number ` b ` , squared and added to a unique another complex number ` a ` resulting in the given complex number ` C ` . Actually, for each complex number ` b ` , ` a = ( C - ( b ^ 2 ) ) ` is unique. Remark: This, together with ~ addsq2reu , shows that commutation of two unique quantifications need not be equivalent, and provides an evident justification of the fact that considering the pair of variables is necessary to obtain what we intuitively understand as "double unique existence". (Proposed by GL, 23-Jun-2023.). (Contributed by AV, 23-Jun-2023.)

blocks.name: addsqrexnreu
blocks.content: For each complex number, there exists a complex number to which the square of more than one (or no) other complex numbers can be added to result in the given complex number. Remark: This theorem, together with ~ addsq2reu , shows that there are cases in which there is a set together with a not unique other set fulfilling a wff, although there is a unique set fulfilling the wff together with another unique set (see ~ addsq2reu ). For more details see comment for ~ addsqnreup . (Contributed by AV, 20-Jun-2023.)

blocks.name: addsqnreup
blocks.content: There is no unique decomposition of a complex number as a sum of a complex number and a square of a complex number. Remark: This theorem, together with ~ addsq2reu , is a real life example (about a numerical property) showing that the pattern ` E! a e. A E! b e. B ph ` does not necessarily mean "There are unique sets ` a ` and ` b ` fulfilling ` ph ` "). See also comments for ~ df-eu and ~ 2eu4 . In the case of decompositions of complex numbers as a sum of a complex number and a square of a complex number, the only/unique complex number to which the square of a unique complex number is added yields in the given complex number is the given number itself, and the unique complex number to be squared is ` 0 ` (see comment for ~ addsq2reu ). There are, however, complex numbers to which the square of more than one other complex numbers can be added to yield the given complex number (see ~ addsqrexnreu ). For example, ` <. 1 , ( sqrt `` ( C - 1 ) ) >. ` and ` <. 1 , -u ( sqrt `` ( C - 1 ) ) >. ` are two different decompositions of ` C ` (if ` C =/= 1 ` ). Therefore, there is no unique decomposition of any complex number as a sum of a complex number and a square of a complex number, as generally proved by this theorem. As a consequence, a theorem must claim the existence of a unique pair of sets to express "There are unique ` a ` and ` b ` so that .." (more formally ` E! p e. ( A X. B ) ph ` with ` p = <. a , b >. ` ), or by showing ` ( E! x e. A E. y e. B ph /\ E! y e. B E. x e. A ph ) ` (see ~ 2reu4 resp. ~ 2eu4 ). These two representations are equivalent (see ~ opreu2reurex ). An analogon of this theorem using the latter variant is given in ~ addsqn2reurex2 . In some cases, however, the variant with (ordered!) pairs may be possible only for ordered sets (like ` RR ` or ` Prime ` ) and claiming that the first component is less than or equal to the second component (see, for example, ~ 2sqreunnltb and ~ 2sqreuopb ). Alternatively, (proper) unordered pairs can be used: ` E! p e ~P A ( ( # `` p ) = 2 /\ ph ) ` , or, using the definition of proper pairs: ` E! p e. ( PrPairs `` A ) ph ` (see, for example, ~ inlinecirc02preu ). (Contributed by AV, 21-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm addsqnreup(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wn(wreu(s0, cxp(cc, cc), wceq(co(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), caddc, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2)), c0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm2.61ine(c0, nat1, wi(wcel(c0, cc), wn(wreu(s0, cxp(cc, cc), wceq(co(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), caddc, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))

  eqtri(co(cfv(c1st, cop(nat1, nat0)), caddc, co(cfv(c2nd, cop(nat1, nat0)), cexp, nat2)), nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat0))

blocks.name: addsq2nreurex
blocks.content: For each complex number ` C ` , there is no unique complex number ` a ` added to the square of another complex number ` b ` resulting in the given complex number ` C ` . (Contributed by AV, 2-Jul-2023.)

blocks.name: addsqn2reurex2
blocks.content: For each complex number ` C ` , there does not uniquely exist two complex numbers ` a ` and ` b ` , with ` b ` squared and added to ` a ` resulting in the given complex number ` C ` . Remark: This, together with ~ addsq2reu , is an example showing that the pattern ` E! a e. A E! b e. B ph ` does not necessarily mean "There are unique sets ` a ` and ` b ` fulfilling ` ph ` ), as it is the case with the pattern ` ( E! a e. A E. b e. B ph /\ E! b e. B E. a e. A ph ` . See also comments for ~ df-eu and ~ 2eu4 . (Contributed by AV, 2-Jul-2023.)

blocks.name: 2sqreulem1

blocks.content: Lemma for ~ 2sqreunnlt . (Contributed by AV, 4-Jun-2023.) Specialization to different integers, proposed by GL. (Revised by AV, 11-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqreunnltlem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: 2sqreunnltblem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ 2sqreunnltb . (Contributed by AV, 11-Jun-2023.) The prime needs not be odd, as observed by WL. (Revised by AV, 18-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqreunnltblem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cprime), wb(wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1), wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  impbid(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1), wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))
  ex(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1), wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))
  2sqreunnltlem(s0, s1, c0)
  pm2.61i(wi(wcel(c0, cprime), wi(wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1))), wceq(c0, nat2))
  a1d(wceq(c0, nat2), wcel(c0, cprime), wi(wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)))
  syl5(wceq(c0, nat2), wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1), wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))
  rexlimdvva(s0, s1, cn, cn, wceq(c0, nat2), wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1))
  impcomd(wa(wceq(c0, nat2), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn))), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1))
  sylbid(wa(wceq(c0, nat2), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn))), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0), wi(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), nat2))
  adantr(wceq(c0, nat2), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wb(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), nat2)))
  eqeq2(c0, nat2, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)))
  adantl(wceq(c0, nat2), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wi(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), nat2), wi(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1))))
  syl6bi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), nat2), wi(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wa(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wceq(cv(s1), nat1)))

blocks.name: 2sqreu
blocks.content: There exists a unique decomposition of a prime of the form ` 4 k + 1 ` as a sum of squares of two nonnegative integers. See ~ 2sqnn0 for the existence of such a decomposition. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jun-2023.) (Revised by AV, 25-Jun-2023.)

thm 2sqreu(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {

blocks.name: 2sqreunn
blocks.content: There exists a unique decomposition of a prime of the form ` 4 k + 1 ` as a sum of squares of two positive integers. See ~ 2sqnn for the existence of such a decomposition. (Contributed by AV, 11-Jun-2023.) (Revised by AV, 25-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqreunn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wa(wreu(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, w0)), wreu(s1, cn, wrex(s0, cn, w0))))

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wa(wreu(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, w0)), wreu(s1, cn, wrex(s0, cn, w0))), wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))))

  reubii(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0))), wreu(s1, cn, w0))
  reubii(s1, cn, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)), w0)
  bicomi(wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)), w0)
  mp1i(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1)), wb(wreu(s0, cn, wreu(s1, cn, w0)), wa(wreu(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, w0)), wreu(s1, cn, wrex(s0, cn, w0)))), wral(s0, cn, wrmo(s1, cn, w0)))

  reubii(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0))), wreu(s1, cn0, w0))

blocks.name: 2sqreultb
blocks.content: There exists a unique decomposition of a prime as a sum of squares of two different nonnegative integers iff ` P == 1 ` (mod 4). (Contributed by AV, 10-Jun-2023.) The prime needs not be odd, as observed by WL. (Revised by AV, 25-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2sqreultb(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3bitrd(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(co(c0, cmo, nat4), nat1), wa(wreu(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, w0)), wreu(s1, cn0, wrex(s0, cn0, w0))), wreu(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))), wreu(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, w0)))

  a1i(wcel(c0, cprime), wb(wreu(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)))), wreu(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, w0))))
  reubii(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0))), wreu(s1, cn0, w0))
  reubii(s1, cn0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)), w0)
  bicomi(wa(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2)), c0)), w0)
  mp1i(wcel(c0, cprime), wb(wreu(s0, cn0, wreu(s1, cn0, w0)), wa(wreu(s0, cn0, wrex(s1, cn0, w0)), wreu(s1, cn0, wrex(s0, cn0, w0)))), wral(s0, cn0, wrmo(s1, cn0, w0)))
  2sqreulem4(s0, s1, c0, w0, wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)))

  diff.cn0.s(s1)

thm 2sqreuopnn(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧(c0[mod]4)= 1)→ ∃!(s0 ∈(ℕ × ℕ),((1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylibr((c0 ∈ Prime ∧(c0[mod]4)= 1), ∃!(s0 ∈(ℕ × ℕ),((1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0)), (∃!(hs0 ∈ ℕ, ∃(hs1 ∈ ℕ,(hs0[≤]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)))∧ ∃!(hs1 ∈ ℕ, ∃(hs0 ∈ ℕ,(hs0[≤]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)))))
  2sqreunn(hs0, hs1, c0, (hs0[≤]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0))
  biid((hs0[≤]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0))
  opreu2reurex(s0, hs0, hs1, cn, cn, ((1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0), (hs0[≤]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0))
  anbi12d(s0 = < hs0, hs1 >, (1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0), (((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0, hs0[≤]hs1, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)
  syl6bb(s0 = < hs0, hs1 >, (1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0), hs0[≤]hs1, (1st ` < hs0, hs1 >)[≤](2nd ` < hs0, hs1 >))
  breq12d((1st ` s0), cle, (2nd ` s0), (1st ` < hs0, hs1 >), (2nd ` < hs0, hs1 >), s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  fveq2(s0, < hs0, hs1 >, c1st)
  fveq2(s0, < hs0, hs1 >, c2nd)
  breq12i((1st ` < hs0, hs1 >), cle, (2nd ` < hs0, hs1 >), hs0, hs1)
  op1st(hs0, hs1)
  op2nd(hs0, hs1)
  eqeq1d((((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2)), c0, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2)), s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  oveq12d(((1st ` s0)[^]2), caddc, ((2nd ` s0)[^]2), (hs0[^]2), (hs1[^]2), s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  oveq1d((1st ` s0), cexp, nat2, hs0, s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  op1std(s0, hs0, hs1)
  oveq1d((2nd ` s0), cexp, nat2, hs1, s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  op2ndd(s0, hs0, hs1)
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs1.c(cn)
  diff.wa.s(s0, hs0[≤]hs1, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, hs0, cle, hs1)
  diff.cle.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2)), c0)
  diff.co.s(s0, (hs0[^]2), caddc, (hs1[^]2))
  diff.co.s(s0, hs0, cexp, nat2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, hs1, cexp, nat2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cexp.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(((1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0))
  diff.hs1.w(((1st ` s0)[≤](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0))

thm 2sqreuopnnltb(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Prime →((c0[mod]4)= 1 ↔ ∃!(s0 ∈(ℕ × ℕ),((1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0))))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  syl6bbr(c0 ∈ Prime, (c0[mod]4)= 1, ∃!(s0 ∈(ℕ × ℕ),((1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0)), (∃!(hs0 ∈ ℕ, ∃(hs1 ∈ ℕ,(hs0[<]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)))∧ ∃!(hs1 ∈ ℕ, ∃(hs0 ∈ ℕ,(hs0[<]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)))))
  2sqreunnltb(hs0, hs1, c0, (hs0[<]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0))
  biid((hs0[<]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0))
  opreu2reurex(s0, hs0, hs1, cn, cn, ((1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0), (hs0[<]hs1 ∧((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0))
  anbi12d(s0 = < hs0, hs1 >, (1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0), (((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0, hs0[<]hs1, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)
  syl6bb(s0 = < hs0, hs1 >, (1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0), hs0[<]hs1, (1st ` < hs0, hs1 >)[<](2nd ` < hs0, hs1 >))
  breq12d((1st ` s0), clt, (2nd ` s0), (1st ` < hs0, hs1 >), (2nd ` < hs0, hs1 >), s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  fveq2(s0, < hs0, hs1 >, c1st)
  fveq2(s0, < hs0, hs1 >, c2nd)
  breq12i((1st ` < hs0, hs1 >), clt, (2nd ` < hs0, hs1 >), hs0, hs1)
  op1st(hs0, hs1)
  op2nd(hs0, hs1)
  eqeq1d((((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2)), c0, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2)), s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  oveq12d(((1st ` s0)[^]2), caddc, ((2nd ` s0)[^]2), (hs0[^]2), (hs1[^]2), s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  oveq1d((1st ` s0), cexp, nat2, hs0, s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  op1std(s0, hs0, hs1)
  oveq1d((2nd ` s0), cexp, nat2, hs1, s0 = < hs0, hs1 >)
  op2ndd(s0, hs0, hs1)
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs1.c(cn)
  diff.wa.s(s0, hs0[<]hs1, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2))= c0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, hs0, clt, hs1)
  diff.clt.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, ((hs0[^]2)[+](hs1[^]2)), c0)
  diff.co.s(s0, (hs0[^]2), caddc, (hs1[^]2))
  diff.co.s(s0, hs0, cexp, nat2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, hs1, cexp, nat2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cexp.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(((1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0))
  diff.hs1.w(((1st ` s0)[<](2nd ` s0)∧(((1st ` s0)[^]2)[+]((2nd ` s0)[^]2))= c0))

blocks.name: 2sqreuopb
blocks.content: There exists a unique decomposition of a prime as a sum of squares of two different positive integers iff the prime is of the form ` 4 k + 1 ` . Alternate ordered pair variant of ~ 2sqreunnltb . (Contributed by AV, 3-Jul-2023.)
